Specific Details: Launch of the Research into the Energy Efficiency of Mobile Homes for Irish Travellers; A collaborative research project between ATU Sligo and National Traveller MABS
Subject Matter: Launch of the Research into the Energy Efficiency of Mobile Homes for Irish Travellers; A collaborative research project between ATU Sligo and National Traveller MABS
Intended Results: Raise awareness of the issues that exist in trying to source a residential standard caravan in Ireland suitable for year round living for Irish Travellers::Raise awareness of the huge costs people are paying to keep warm in substandard accommodation::Advocate for a Caravan Rental Scheme to complement the existing caravan loan scheme.
Lobbying Activities: Phone call to Senator Flynn on the 11/11/22 to ask her to launch the research report .  12/12/22 Senator Flynn attended the launch at the Ashling Hotel in Dublin to officially launch the report.|Event / Reception|1

Subject Matter: Clarification from Government as to how Travellers in mobiles and other living situations could avail of the credit which they missed out on in 2022/2023.

Email sent to Senator Flynn, Minister Eamon Ryan, Minister Ossian Smyth and to Ministersdiary@decc.gov.ie requesting a meeting. 19/01/2023
A follow up email requesting a meeting was sent on 01/02/2023 and another follow up email was sent on the 24/02/2023.
Two emails were sent on the 24/02/23 & 01/02/23 to set the date and time for the meeting. 
A email was sent on the 02/03/24 to add Denise Collins NTMABS to the attendance list. |Email|2-5::A meeting was held in Minister Smyths office with Minister Smyth National Traveller MABS staff (Nancy Power, Denise Collins and Aoife Foley) Senator Eileen Flynn and Gillian Clarke from the Ministers Office. |Meeting|1

Specific Details: Clarification from Government as to how Travellers in mobiles and other living situations could avail of the credit which they missed out on in 2022/2023.
DPOs Lobbied: Ossian Smyth|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Eileen Flynn|Senator|Seanad
Subject Matter: Clarification from Government as to how Travellers in mobiles and other living situations could avail of the credit which they missed out on in 2022/2023.
Intended Results: Clarification from Government as to how Travellers in mobiles and other living situations could avail of the credit which they missed out on in 2022/2023.
Lobbying Activities:
Nancy Power rang Justina Corcoran on 27/09/23 to follow up on a previous meeting to try and organise a site visit as requested by Minister Smyth. The call was unanswered and a voicemail was left. Calls & texts to Justina on the 14 & 15 November to organise Minister's visit to site in South Dublin. |Phone call|2-5::Nancy Power returned a missed call to Senator Eileen Flynn on the 27/09/23. Senator Flynn was seeking an update on the site visit and credits issue. |Phone call|1::33 emails were sent between Nancy Power (NTMABS) and Justina Corcoran (Head of Retail Energy Policy and Regulation
Department of Environment, Climate and Communications), Senator Eileen Flynn and Geraldine Dunne (Director STAG) with a view to setting up a site visit requested by Minister Smyth to meet people who were affected by not receiving the electricity credits with a view to reimbursing those who missed out. 
|Email|31-50::Minister Smyth made a site visit on the 17th November 2023. Nancy Power NTMABS present. |Meeting|1::3 emails were sent between Justina Corcoran and Nancy Power following up on actions arising out of the site visit on the 17th November from the 21/11/23 to the 19/12/23.|Email|2-5

Specific Details: An invitation was sent to all T.D.'s and Senators to invite them to the launch of NTMABS research report into financial literacy in the Traveller community.
Subject Matter: An invitation was sent to all T.D.'s and Senators to invite them to the launch of NTMABS research report into financial literacy in the Traveller community.
Intended Results: T.D.'s and Senators to attend the launch of the NTMABS research report 'Financial Unwellness' and to have it's findings considered as part of the Financial Literacy Strategy currently being prepared.
Lobbying Activities: An email invitation was sent to the Minister for Finances office on the 24th April 2024 by Nancy Power asking the Minister if he would attend the launch of the research report. A draft copy of the report was sent with the email. An acknowledgement was received from the Ministers office on the 26th May. The Minister agreed to attend and emails were sent back and forth to his office organising his attendance at the event. The Minister did not attend the event.|Email|1::An email invitation was sent to the Senator to ask her to attend and speak at the launch. Emails were exchanged with details of the event and some talking points for the event and about the report|Email|2-5
